title: Demi Moore sizzles in navy jumpsuit as she gives prize to Lena Dunham at Friendly House Awards
text:
She has been candid about her own drinking problem.

And Demi Moore, who is now sober, showed her support for the Los Angeles women's rehab the Peggy Albrecht Friendly House on Saturday.

The 56-year-old took the stage at the 30th Annual Friendly House Awards luncheon at the Beverly Hilton to give a prize to Lena Dunham.

Looking fab: Demi Moore, who is now sober, showed her support for the Los Angeles women's rehab the Peggy Albrecht Friendly House on Saturday

Lena, who went sober in April 2018, is getting the Woman Of The Year Award and held a benefit for Friendly House at her place this year, per The Hollywood Reporter.

For the Beverly Hilton shindig, Demi draped her svelte figure in a navy blue peekaboo jumpsuit and wore her signature dark hair down.

The event was being hostessed by Katey Sagal, who could be spotted posing up a storm with Lena during the red carpet portion.

Katy, who achieved TV icon status on such shows as Sons Of Anarchy and Married... With Children, has been sober for over three decades.

Honoree: The 56-year-old took the stage at the 30th Annual Friendly House Awards luncheon at the Beverly Hilton to give a prize to Lena Dunham

Backstory: Lena, who went sober in April 2018, is getting the Woman Of The Year Award and held a benefit for Friendly House at her place this year, per The Hollywood Reporter

Japanese model Yu Yamada could also be spotted at the event wearing a frilly floral dress that was hemmed around mid-thigh.

When Demi herself was named a Friendly House Woman Of The Year in 2018 she told The Hollywood Reporter: 'I always struggle with that feeling like: "Have I really done enough to be here?" and there is still so much more to do and to give back.'

She added: 'But at the same time you do sometimes have to take pause and allow for acknowledgment just so that you can really take in how far you’ve come to then give you the energy to move forward and to keep doing more.'

Demi gushed: 'I just love everything about Friendly House and what’s been created for 67 years now. The fact that they present an opportunity for women who don’t have the resources to find recovery I think is incredible.'

In her new memoir Inside Out, released last month, Demi was frank about her experiences with addiction and her marriages.

She has made a major media splash by writing about her infamous failed marriage to Ashton Kutcher, who is 15 years her junior.

Demi claimed he was unfaithful to her twice and that they had a pair of threesomes, adding that she was 'addicted' to him.

The A Few Good Men actress also wrote that she fell off the wagon after she suffered a miscarriage while six months pregnant with Ashton's baby.

Demi had been 20 years sober but resumed drinking to cope with her loss after Ashton said: 'I don't know if alcoholism is a real thing,' she wrote.

Ashton has gone on to marry his old That 70s Show co-star Mila Kunis, with whom he shares his daughter Wyatt, five, and son Dimitri, two.

As Demi did the publicity rounds for the new book and her claims about Ashton circulated, he addressed the matter on Twitter.

'I was about to push the button on a really snarky tweet. Then I saw my son, daughter, and wife and I deleted it,' he wrote the day Inside Out was released.
